exclusion:
1. Bring the sensor within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway (hub).
  2. Put the Z-Wave binding into exclusion mode.
  3. Press and release the Z-Wave button 3 times quickly.
  4. Your hub will confirm exclusion and the sensor will disappear from your controller's device list.
inclusion:
1. Put your Z-Wave hub into inclusion mode.
  2. Click the Z-Wave button 3 times as quickly as possible. The LED indicator will start blinking to confirm inclusion mode and turn off once inclusion is completed. The sensor will automatically pair as a repeater if connected to USB power, so special button sequence required.

NEVER include the sensor powered with USB and then switch over to batteries. Your hub will recognize the sensor as a Z-Wave repeater and the batteries will drain quickly. Always include the sensor powered by batteries only if you're planning to use it as a battery device.
label: ZSE11
overview:
• Quick and reliable motion alerts to Z-Wave hub
  • Accurate temperature and humidity monitoring
  • Lux sensor for smart light automation
  • Battery or Micro USB power
  • The latest S2 security and Z-Wave Plus chip
  • Supports OTA fiormware updates
  • Built-in tamper switch for extra security
usage:
• This product should be installed indoors or outdoors in a sheltered area upon completion of any building renovations.
  • Prior to installation, the device should be stored in a dry, dust-and-mold-proof place.
  • Do not install the device in a place with direct sun exposure, high temperature, or humidity.
  • Keep away from chemicals, water, and dust.
  • Ensure the device is never close to any heat source or open flame to prevent fire.
  • No part of the device may be replaced or repaired by the user except for the batteries.
wakeup: The sensor's wake-up intevral is set to 4 hours by default to save battery life. Use the Wake up Command Class to adjust the interval (in seconds, working in 3600s intervals, with 120 as min and 86400 as max values). Press and hold the Z-Wave button for 3 seconds to wake the sensor up manually. During wake-up, the sensor turns on the Z-Wave radio for a couple of seconds to receive communication from the hub. Long wake-up intervals will not affect how often the sensor reports motion or other values to your hub.

parameters.label: Motion sensitivity
parameters.overview: 0 is disabled, 1 is low sensitivity, and 8 is high sensitivity.

parameters.label: Motion clear time
parameters.description: The delay in seconds before the sensor reports no motion
parameters.overview: The delay in seconds before the sensor reports no motion to the hub and associated devices after detecting the last motion activity.

parameters.label: Motion Detection: Send Basic Set
parameters.description: Enable or disable basic set reporting when motion is detected.
parameters.overview: 0 – don’t send basic set reports when motion is detected; 1 – send basic set reports when motion is detected (default).

parameters.label: Motion Detection: Basic Set Value
parameters.description: Select the basic set value to be sent when motion is detected.
parameters.overview: Select which basic set value to send when motion is detected: 0 – send 0xFF basic set report (ON) when motion is detected (default); 1 – send 0x00 basic set report (OFF) when motion is detected.

parameters.label: Motion Detection: Send Binary Sensor Reports
parameters.description: Enable or disable binary sensor reports when motion is detected.
parameters.overview: If disabled, notification reports will be sent instead

parameters.label: Temperature Unit
parameters.description: Set temperature reporting units (F or C)

parameters.label: LED motion indicator
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable LED indicator for motion alerts.
0 - don’t flash LED when motion is detected
1 - flash LED indicator when motion is detected (default).

parameters.label: Low Battery Alert Threshold
parameters.description: % level for the sensor to report low battery to your hub.

parameters.label: Reporting frequency
parameters.description: The reporting frequency for battery, temperature, humidity, and light level
parameters.overview:
Set the reporting frequency for battery, temperature, humidity, and light level. This is the minimum interval in which the sensor will send updates to the hub even if the reporting threshold isn't met. The values correspond to the number of hours.

Note: Frequent reports will affect battery life.

parameters.label: Temperature reporting threshold
parameters.overview: The sensor will report a new temperature value to the hub whenever temperature changes by the number of degrees entered as value.

parameters.label: Humidity reporting threshold
parameters.overview: Set the reporting threshold for humidity. The sensor will report a new humidity value to the hub whenever humidity changes by the percentage number entered as value.

parameters.label: Lux reporting threshold
parameters.overview: Set the reporting threshold for lux. The sensor will report new lux to the hub whenever the brightness level changes by the number of lux entered as value.

associations.label: Group 1
associations.overview: This device will send a Notification and Sensor Multilevel Report to Group 1 whenever it detects motion

associations.label: Group 2
associations.overview: This device will send a Basic Set command to Group 2 whenever it detects motion
